title: Mac Client is Broken
body: Mac client constantly crashes in game 2-3 times per game, every game. Several threads in our respective section, with zero responses. This is always how it is, give us some active moderators for Mac tech support or just scrap the client if you have no interest in your Mac players. It's disgusting seeing responses in general discussion and bug reports (and reddit...) and never in the Mac Client forums. Fix your Mac tech support team, thanks.

replies.body: Thanks for reporting this.  We are aware of this and working to fix it.  I'll come back with more info when I have it

Thank you for letting us know you guys at Riot are on top of this. Since the release of patch 4.17 been a real issue for us on the mac client. 

I play League with my 2 brothers all 3 of us going into que together with the mac client. Through the games we have tried all three of us crash on average 2-4 times each game before the 20 minute mark. From what we have seen the game will freeze briefly before it closes altogether followed by either a bugsplat error message or the mac "would you like to report this problem?" message. Intervals of which we crash vary and we do not always crash at the same time as one another. From trying different modes on League we have found that we do not crash in custom Summoners Rift vs bots, custom ARAM 1v1, and ARAM PvP. From that the issue seems to be tied specifically to PvP in Summoners Rift. 

Hope that helps and that the issue is resolved quickly. :S
This was helpful thanks!

I would like it to be known that I have indeed crashed in ARAM PvP, so it is not tied to summoners rift. Also the crashes seem to be pretty inconsistent, ranging from crashing 3 or 4 times to not at all.

If its repetitive like the Summoners Rift crashes that would show us it could be broader then summoners rift. On the other hand if your crashing in ARAM does not have the same characteristics as the crashing in Summoners Rift then that would show your crashing is just part of the inconsistencies of the mac client. (It is the beta version after all.) 

Just my two cents on this, in the end its Riot's call.

**Dear Riot**, 
       I have been reading your comments asking us Mac users to run tests on each game mode, custom and not custom. I went through and did all of these things to no avail. I went through and attempted to create a custom game on each mode having bots and then also no bots(just me). Every time i did this, i wouldn't connect as usual. I don't get any champion panels, i just get a frozen black screen, which i can only exit by using Command Option Escape. I attempt to hit the orange reconnect button but i get the same results as before, a black screen. i can exit the black screen and attempt to reconnect once more before it doesn't show that i am in game when i restart league. I also would like to point out that the same things are happening with normal games. I have tried a normal game twice but i won't try anything else for the fear of losing LP(resulting in demotion) or getting reported and receiving a leaver mark which could get me banned. i have a lot of free time, so if you need me to test anything for you i have a lot of free time. Feel free to email me at Phillips.kirk@yahoo.com. Thank you for your time, can't wait to get back on the rift!

I had the same problem. do you hear a noise when you click the black screen?

if you do, the only way currently known to fix it is to do a complete system restore, then reinstalling League of Legends. Don't be worried. if you keep backups through time machine, then you can restore your mac back to its original state. Just press Command-R on startup, and go through to reinstall OS X Mavericks.

More info on how to do this process on Apple's Page: https://www.apple.com/osx/recovery/

Make sure to click the reinstall OSX

Hope that helps!

I'm happy to know that Riot is aware of the issue. I've been playing league of legends for at least 3 years now, and ever since the mac client came out I've experienced bugs. However, I've experienced more issues in the last 3-4 months than ever before. Most of my problems are either 2-3 lag spikes/game or client crashes. What's strange is that sometimes it's perfectly fine. These issues seem to come out of nowhere. The client doesn't crash that often for me, but when it does, it crashes every ~5 minutes after about 15-20 minutes into the game (summoner's rift ranked). Sometimes I get a bug splat error report, sometime I don't. It has cost me games sometimes (I'm trying to be constructive and not rant). 

I'm currently running 10.10.2 (Yosemite) 8GB RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GT 650M 1024 MB, 2.6 GHz Intel Core i7 (up to 3.6 GHz). 

I also get issues when I try to play full resolution 15.4-inch (2880 x 1800) by changing the in game settings. So I have to downscale and play at 1440. Issues range from the mouse not being able to go on certain areas of the screen (like there's an invisible wall), weird camera angles/zooms and sensitivity etc. 

I really hope that one day the mac client can be bug free.

I have the normal Mac problems while in game (ping higher than usual, fps dropping every so often, crashing and such), but it recently got worse after I downloaded the 4.19 patch. I upgraded to OS X Yosemite a couple days ago, and it was working fine de to me not having 4.19. I had one game where my ping sustained 550-600 and my fps 25-30, compared to my usual 80-120 ping and 45-60 fps. This was after upgrading to Yosemite. 

After downloading 4.19, I can't play a game without skyrocketing to at least 800 ping (10,900+ being the highest it's been). I've tested it on all the maps, as well as PvP and custom games. They're all the same: I crash 3-5 times; 800+ ping, 20-30 fps. Most of the time, it doesn't even make it to in game. I'm stuck at 100% in the loading screen until I either I forcefully restart my computer, or until recently, used command + option + escape.
